results.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
results.creator_credit: Paramount, Bad Robot, Skydance Media, TC Productions, Alibaba Pictures Group, Christopher McQuarrie, Bruce Geller, Tom Cruise, J.J. Abrams, Peter Wenham, Dana Goldberg, Jake Myers, Bryan Burk, Don Granger, David Ellison and Raphaël Benoliel
results.headline_credit: China, France, Norway and United States of America, 2018
results.brief_description: When an IMF mission ends badly, the world is faced with dire consequences. As Ethan Hunt takes it upon himself to fulfill his original briefing, the CIA begin to question his loyalty and his motives. The IMF team find themselves in a race against time, hunted by assassins while trying to prevent a global catastrophe.

constellations_other.name: Kylie to Lucy
constellations_other.description: 'Did It Again' started the conversation about Kylie Minogue being more than just a pop star, it started to cement her status as one of the most important audio and visual artists of her time, but the video had an unlikely inspiration.

results.title: Mission: Impossible
results.creator_credit: Barry Crane, Robert H. Justman, Allan Balter, William Woodfield, Joseph Gantman, Desilu Productions and Paramount Television Studios
results.brief_description: Mission: Impossible is an American television series that was created and initially produced by Bruce Geller. It chronicles the missions of a team of secret government agents known as the Impossible Missions Force.

constellations_other.name: Kylie to Lucy
constellations_other.description: 'Did It Again' started the conversation about Kylie Minogue being more than just a pop star, it started to cement her status as one of the most important audio and visual artists of her time, but the video had an unlikely inspiration.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Crane, Robert H. Justman, Allan Balter, William Woodfield, Joseph Gantman, Desilu Productions and Paramount Television Studios
results.description:
Mission: Impossible is an American television series that was created and initially produced by Bruce Geller. It chronicles the missions of a team of secret government agents known as the Impossible Missions Force. In the first season, the team is led by Dan Briggs, played by Steven Hill; Jim Phelps, played by Peter Graves, takes charge for the remaining seasons. A hallmark of the series shows Briggs or Phelps receiving his instructions on a recording that then self-destructs, followed by the theme music composed by Lalo Schifrin.

The series aired on the CBS network from September 1966 to March 1973, then returned to television for two seasons on ABC, from 1988 to 1990, retaining only Graves in the cast. It later inspired a popular series of theatrical motion pictures starring Tom Cruise, beginning in 1996.
description_for_label:
Mission: Impossible is an American television series that was created and initially produced by Bruce Geller. It chronicles the missions of a team of secret government agents known as the Impossible Missions Force. In the first season, the team is led by Dan Briggs, played by Steven Hill; Jim Phelps, played by Peter Graves, takes charge for the remaining seasons. A hallmark of the series shows Briggs or Phelps receiving his instructions on a recording that then self-destructs, followed by the theme music composed by Lalo Schifrin.

The series aired on the CBS network from September 1966 to March 1973, then returned to television for two seasons on ABC, from 1988 to 1990, retaining only Graves in the cast. It later inspired a popular series of theatrical motion pictures starring Tom Cruise, beginning in 1996.

results.title: Mishima: A Life in Four Chapters
results.creator_credit: Mataichirô Yamamoto, Lucasfilm Ltd., American Zoetrope, Tristone Entertainment Inc., M Company, Tom Luddy, Paul Schrader, Leonard Schrader, Catherine Craig, Eiko Ishioka and Etsuko Yagyu
results.headline_credit: Japan and United States of America, 1985
results.brief_description: A fictional account of the life of Japanese author Yukio Mishima told in four parts. The first three parts relate events in three of his novels: The Temple of the Golden Pavilion, Kyoko’s House, and Runaway Horses. The last part depicts the events of 25th November 1970.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mataichirô Yamamoto, Lucasfilm Ltd., American Zoetrope, Tristone Entertainment Inc., M Company, Tom Luddy, Paul Schrader, Leonard Schrader, Catherine Craig, Eiko Ishioka and Etsuko Yagyu
results.description: A fictional account of the life of Japanese author Yukio Mishima told in four parts. The first three parts relate events in three of his novels: The Temple of the Golden Pavilion, Kyoko’s House, and Runaway Horses. The last part depicts the events of 25th November 1970.

results.title: Mindhunter
results.creator_credit: Jim Davidson, Steve Arnold, Jennifer Starzyk, Liz Hannah, Panic Pictures / No. 13, Denver and Delilah Productions and Jen X Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: An agent in the FBI’s Elite Serial Crime Unit develops profiling techniques as he pursues notorious serial killers and rapists.

constellations_other.name: Eric Bana
constellations_other.description: There must be something that draws Australian creatives like Eric Bana to darker material as they shoot to stardom overseas. Australia's penal colony past perhaps?

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Davidson, Steve Arnold, Jennifer Starzyk, Liz Hannah, Panic Pictures / No. 13, Denver and Delilah Productions and Jen X Productions, Inc.

results.title: Meet the Robinsons
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney Animation Studios, Stephen J. Anderson, Michelle Bochner Spitz, Dorothy McKim and Aurian Redson
results.brief_description: In this animated adventure, brilliant preteen inventor Lewis creates a memory scanner to retrieve his earliest recollections and find out why his mother gave him up for adoption.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney Animation Studios, Stephen J. Anderson, Michelle Bochner Spitz, Dorothy McKim and Aurian Redson
results.description: Lewis, a brilliant young inventor, is keen on creating a time machine to find his mother, who abandoned him in an orphanage. Things take a turn when he meets Wilbur Robinson and his family.
description_for_label: Lewis, a brilliant young inventor, is keen on creating a time machine to find his mother, who abandoned him in an orphanage. Things take a turn when he meets Wilbur Robinson and his family.

results.title: Media Watch
results.brief_description: An Australian media analysis television program currently focusing on critiquing the Australian media.

constellations_other.name: Newsreel to nightly news
constellations_other.description: For decades, newsreel companies covered the news, providing weekly stories of current events, sport, and entertainment to audiences at the cinema, and establishing the format that would be taken up by television and the nightly news.

results.description: An Australian media analysis television program currently focusing on critiquing the Australian media.
description_for_label: An Australian media analysis television program currently focusing on critiquing the Australian media.

results.title: Marvel's The Punisher
results.creator_credit: Bohemian Risk Productions and ABC Studios
results.brief_description: A former Marine out to punish the criminals responsible for his family’s murder finds himself ensnared in a military conspiracy.

constellations_other.name: Powerful women in the frame and behind the scenes
constellations_other.description: Lady Sarah (Rachel Weisz) exudes power in The Favourite. These female filmmakers and actors do too.

results.description: A former Marine out to punish the criminals responsible for his family’s murder finds himself ensnared in a military conspiracy.
description_for_label: A former Marine out to punish the criminals responsible for his family’s murder finds himself ensnared in a military conspiracy.

results.title: Marguerite
results.brief_description: Marguerite, an opera singer who assumes that she is the best, decides to organise a concert, unaware of the fact that her husband, friends and colleagues are not impressed with her vocal skills.

constellations_other.name: Voice and the moving image
constellations_other.description: Sound changed cinema, but it wasn't always welcome, but it hasn't stopped people aspiring for the spotlight.

results.description: Paris in the 1920s. Marguerite Dumont is a wealthy woman with a passion for music and the opera. For years, she has performed regularly for a circle of guests. But Marguerite sings tragically out of tune and no one has ever told her. Her husband and her close friends have always encouraged her in her illusions. Things become very complicated the day she gets it into her head to perform in front of a genuine public, at the Opera.
description_for_label: Paris in the 1920s. Marguerite Dumont is a wealthy woman with a passion for music and the opera. For years, she has performed regularly for a circle of guests. results.title: Making the Band 4
results.brief_description: Making the Band 4 aired on MTV from June 18, 2007 to April 23, 2009. It centers on Diddy search for an all-male super group.

results.title: Making a Murderer
results.brief_description: Filmed over 10 years, this real-life thriller follows a DNA exoneree who, while exposing police corruption, becomes a suspect in a grisly new crime.

constellations_other.name: Reasonable doubt
constellations_other.description: Factual media has the power to reframe information and put forth new, persuasive arguments.  For the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, True Crime media has the ability to create doubt, right the wrongs of the justice system, and shed new light on closed cases.

results.description: Filmed over 10 years, this real-life thriller follows a DNA exoneree who, while exposing police corruption, becomes a suspect in a grisly new crime.
